result.execSummary:
The defendant Jackson H Michaelis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be:$443] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 9  days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.
--no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or ammunition
The Court determines Mr. Michaelis eligible to request expungement upon successful completion of probation.

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent

--to comply with DNA sample provision 

--The Court orders firearm used in incident destroyed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jackson H Michaelis

records.addlTxt:
Order Firearms Destroy

ec/pc: DA, Def, JCJ (4/22/22--ma)

[ma] Case called at 3:38 PM 
Defendant Jackson H Michaelis in court.   Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Parson indicates that pretrial occurred and case is resolved. 

The Court finds Defendant competent to represent himself; further that waiver of counsel is being made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given.

The Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or ammunition
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be:$443] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 9  days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.  
 
The Court determines Mr. Michaelis eligible to request expungment upon successful completion of probation.
The Court orders firearm used in incident destroyed. 

Days credit for time already served:  1  day
recess: 4:03pm

Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on April 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[ae] case called 11:16 AM Defendant Jackson H Michaelis in court.  ADA Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no contact with Victim 1
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 11:21 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/16/22 at 11:00 am (2) Status Conference on 4/21/22 at 3:30 pm
